Package ca.eandb.jmist.math

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Tuple.Filter
    Filters the real numbers.
    Tuple.Function
    Represents a function from the real numbers to the real numbers.
    Tuple.Operator
    A binary operator on the real numbers.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AffineMatrix2
    A 3x3 matrix of the form \[\left( \begin{matrix} a & b & x \\ c & d & y \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{matrix} \right)\] for applying two dimensional affine transformations.
    AffineMatrix3
    A 4x4 matrix of the form \[\left( \begin{matrix} a & b & c & x \\ d & e & f & y \\ g & h & i & z \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \end{matrix} \right)\] for applying three dimensional affine transformations.
    Array2<T>
    A generic two dimensional array.
    Basis3
    An orthonormal basis in three dimensional space.
    Box2
    An axis-aligned two dimensional box.
    Box3
    An axis-aligned three dimensional box.
    Circle
    A circle in two dimensional space (the set of points at most a constant distance from a fixed point).
    Complex
    A complex number.
    GeometryUtil
    Static geometric utility methods.
    HPoint2
    A homogenized point in 2D space.
    HPoint3
    A homogenized point in 3D space.
    Interval
    An closed interval [a, b] on the real number line.
    LinearMatrix2
    A 3x3 matrix of the form \[\left( \begin{matrix} a & b & 0 \\ c & d & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{matrix} \right)\] for applying two dimensional linear transformations.
    LinearMatrix3
    A 4x4 matrix of the form \[\left( \begin{matrix} a & b & c & 0 \\ d & e & f & 0 \\ g & h & i & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 1 \end{matrix} \right)\] for applying three dimensional linear transformations.
    MathUtil
    Static mathematical utility methods.
    Matrix
    A two dimensional matrix.
    Matrix4
    A 4x4 matrix.
    MatrixBuffer
    Mutable element-storage for a two-dimensional matrix.
    Optics
    Provides utility methods for geometric optics.
    Physics
    Provides constants and utility methods for physics.
    Plane3
    A plane in three dimensional space.
    Point2
    A location in two dimensional space.
    Point3
    A location in three dimensional space.
    PolarCoordinates
    Two dimensional vector represented using polar coordinates.
    Polynomial
    Represents a polynomial.
    Quadric
    Represents a quadric surface, i.e., the solution to xtQx = 0, where x = (x y z 1)t and Q is the 4x4 symmetric matrix characterizing the surface.
    Ray2
    A ray (half-line) in two dimensional space.
    Ray3
    A ray (half-line) in three dimensional space.
    Solver
    Solves mathematical equations.
    Sphere
    A sphere in two dimensional space (the set of points at most a constant distance from a fixed point).
    SphericalCoordinates
    Three dimensional vector represented using spherical coordinates.
    Spheroid
    An ellipsoid with two equal axes.
    Trig
    This class contains precomputed arrays of trigonometric quantities.
    Tuple
    An immutable array of double precision values.
    Tuple2
    A tuple of two values.
    Tuple3
    A tuple of three values.
    Tuple4
    A tuple of four values.
    Vector2
    The difference between two points in two dimensional space.
    Vector3
    The difference between two points in three dimensional space.
    Vector4
    The difference between two points in four dimensional space.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Basis3.Orientation
    Indicates whether a Basis3 is left or right handed.
